briefdescription.para: Constructor, taking an optional parent pointer.

memberdef.argsstring: (wxDC &dc, const wxRichTextRange &range, const wxRichTextSelection &selection, const wxRect &rect, int descent, int style)=0
memberdef.name: Draw

briefdescription.para: Draw the item, within the given range.

detaileddescription.para: Some objects may ignore the range (for example paragraphs) while others must obey it (lines, to implement wrapping)

briefdescription.para: Lay the item out at the specified position with the given size constraint.

detaileddescription.para: Layout must set the cached size.

memberdef.argsstring: (wxDC &dc, const wxPoint &pt, long &textPosition, wxRichTextObject **obj, wxRichTextObject **contextObj, int flags=0)
memberdef.name: HitTest

briefdescription.para: Hit-testing: returns a flag indicating hit test details, plus information about position.

detaileddescription.para: contextObj is returned to specify what object position is relevant to, since otherwise there's an ambiguity. @ obj might not be a child of contextObj, since we may be referring to the container itself if we have no hit on a child - for example if we click outside an object.
The function puts the position in textPosition if one is found. pt is in logical units (a zero y position is at the beginning of the buffer).

memberdef.argsstring: (wxDC &WXUNUSED(dc), long WXUNUSED(index), wxPoint &WXUNUSED(pt), int *WXUNUSED(height), bool WXUNUSED(forceLineStart))
memberdef.name: FindPosition

briefdescription.para: Finds the absolute position and row height for the given character position.
Returns the best size, i.e.

detaileddescription.para: the ideal starting size for this object irrespective of available space. For a short text string, it will be the size that exactly encloses the text. For a longer string, it might use the parent width for example.

memberdef.argsstring: (const wxRichTextRange &range, wxSize &size, int &descent, wxDC &dc, int flags, wxPoint position=wxPoint(0, 0), wxArrayInt *partialExtents=NULL) const =0
memberdef.name: GetRangeSize

briefdescription.para: Returns the object size for the given range.

detaileddescription.para: Returns false if the range is invalid for this object.

briefdescription.para: Do a split from pos, returning an object containing the second part, and setting the first part in 'this'.
Calculates the range of the object.

detaileddescription.para: By default, guess that the object is 1 unit long.

briefdescription.para: Deletes the given range.
Returns true if the object is empty.
Returns true if this class of object is floatable.
Returns true if this object is currently floating.
Returns the floating direction.
Returns any text in this object for the given range.
Returns true if this object can merge itself with the given one.
Returns true if this object merged itself with the given one.

detaileddescription.para: The calling code will then delete the given object.

briefdescription.para: Dump object data to the given output stream for debugging.
Returns true if we can edit the object's properties via a GUI.
Edits the object's properties via a GUI.
Returns the label to be used for the properties context menu item.
Returns true if objects of this class can accept the focus, i.e.

detaileddescription.para: a call to SetFocusObject is possible. For example, containers supporting text, such as a text box object, can accept the focus, but a table can't (set the focus to individual cells instead).

briefdescription.para: Returns true if this object takes note of paragraph attributes (text and image objects don't).
Returns the XML node name of this object.

detaileddescription.para: This must be overridden for wxXmlNode-base XML export to work.

briefdescription.para: Invalidates the object at the given range.

detaileddescription.para: With no argument, invalidates the whole object.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if this object can handle the selections of its children, fOr example a table.

detaileddescription.para: Required for composite selection handling to work.

briefdescription.para: Returns a selection object specifying the selections between start and end character positions.

detaileddescription.para: For example, a table would deduce what cells (of range length 1) are selected when dragging across the table.

briefdescription.para: Gets the cached object size as calculated by Layout.
Sets the cached object size as calculated by Layout.
Gets the maximum object size as calculated by Layout.

detaileddescription.para: This allows us to fit an object to its contents or allocate extra space if required.

briefdescription.para: Sets the maximum object size as calculated by Layout.

detaileddescription.para: This allows us to fit an object to its contents or allocate extra space if required.

briefdescription.para: Gets the minimum object size as calculated by Layout.

detaileddescription.para: This allows us to constrain an object to its absolute minimum size if necessary.

briefdescription.para: Sets the minimum object size as calculated by Layout.

detaileddescription.para: This allows us to constrain an object to its absolute minimum size if necessary.

briefdescription.para: Gets the 'natural' size for an object.

detaileddescription.para: For an image, it would be the image size.

briefdescription.para: Returns the object position in pixels.
Sets the object position in pixels.
Returns the absolute object position, by traversing up the child/parent hierarchy.

detaileddescription.para: TODO: may not be needed, if all object positions are in fact relative to the top of the coordinate space.

briefdescription.para: Returns the rectangle enclosing the object.
Sets the object's range within its container.
Returns the object's range.
Returns the object's range.
Set the object's own range, for a top-level object with its own position space.
Returns the object's own range (valid if top-level).
Returns the object's own range (valid if top-level).
Returns the object's own range only if a top-level object.
Returns true if this object this composite.
Returns a pointer to the parent object.
Sets the pointer to the parent object.
Returns the top-level container of this object.

detaileddescription.para: May return itself if it's a container; use GetParentContainer to return a different container.

briefdescription.para: Returns the top-level container of this object.

detaileddescription.para: Returns a different container than itself, unless there's no parent, in which case it will return NULL.

briefdescription.para: Set the margin around the object, in pixels.

memberdef.argsstring: (int leftMargin, int rightMargin, int topMargin, int bottomMargin)

Returns the right margin of the object, in pixels.

Returns the bottom margin of the object, in pixels.
Calculates the available content space in the given rectangle, given the margins, border and padding specified in the object's attributes.

briefdescription.para: Lays out the object first with a given amount of space, and then if no width was specified in attr, lays out the object again using the minimum size.

detaileddescription.para: contains its own paragraphs, such as a text box.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the object will be shown, false otherwise.
Call to show or hide this object.

detaileddescription.para: This function does not cause the content to be laid out or redrawn.

briefdescription.para: Clones the object.

memberdef.name: DrawBoxAttributes

briefdescription.para: Draws the borders and background for the given rectangle and attributes.

detaileddescription.para: boxRect is taken to be the outer margin box, not the box around the content.

briefdescription.para: Draws a border.

memberdef.name: GetBoxRects

briefdescription.para: Returns the various rectangles of the box model in pixels.

detaileddescription.para: You can either specify contentRect (inner) or marginRect (outer), and the other must be the default rectangle (no width or height). Note that the outline doesn't affect the position of the rectangle, it's drawn in whatever space is available.

memberdef.argsstring: (wxDC &dc, wxRichTextBuffer *buffer, const wxRichTextAttr &attr, int &leftMargin, int &rightMargin, int &topMargin, int &bottomMargin)
memberdef.name: GetTotalMargin

briefdescription.para: Returns the total margin for the object in pixels, taking into account margin, padding and border size.

memberdef.name: AdjustAvailableSpace

briefdescription.para: Returns the rectangle which the child has available to it given restrictions specified in the child attribute, e.g.

detaileddescription.para: 50% width of the parent, 400 pixels, x position 20% of the parent, etc.

briefdescription.para: This is the base for drawable rich text objects.
